body_html: Though I don't think I fully understand what's your problem, but you should not use tf.train.global_step for this. tf.train.get_or_create_global_step will give you the global step variable (instead of the value) and that's what you need. But still I'm not sure whether it works with high-level wrappers such as slim which takes control of the increment.

body: Though I don't think I fully understand what's your problem, but you should not use `tf.train.global_step` for this. `tf.train.get_or_create_global_step` will give you the global step __variable__ (instead of the value) and that's what you need. But still I'm not sure whether it works with high-level wrappers such as slim which takes control of the increment.
